jobs.title: Founding Sales Recruiter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Double (Formerly Keeper)

Bookkeepers today are stuck working in excel spreadsheets and homegrown project management solutions to support their clients. Double is on a mission to change that.

With our all-in-one tool, bookkeepers can manage their work, communicate with clients, catch hard-to-find errors, and deliver reports to help their small business customers make smarter strategic decisions.

Founded in 2021, Double has raised $12M in funding, backed by leading tech investors like Y Combinator and founders at top startups like Lattice, Front, Superhuman, Plaid, and more. Double currently helps thousands of bookkeepers and accountants manage the books for startups and small businesses across the US.

What you’ll do

Your job is to find, qualify, and attract top talent to join our Sales team.

This role will report to the Sales Manager.

You will be the first full-time in-house recruiter at Double. While we expect you to bring your experience and expertise to help us streamline our recruiting processes, this is still a roll-up-your-sleeves and get-things-done type of position where you will be sourcing applications, cold calling, cold emailing, and cold LI Messaging potential candidates.

You will be given a very high level of autonomy, a budget, and the best tech stack you need to succeed.

You can run experiments and be creative. Want to travel to various campuses around the country and recruit? Go for it. Want to host a lunch and learn for a group of candidates? Go for it. Want to try something new that has never been done before, but you think it can work? Go for it.

We are ready to hire 20+ new high-quality SDRs over the next 6 weeks. Can you get us there?

Key Responsibilities:

  • As the Founding Recruiter in Sales, you will help us streamline our hiring processes as we implement our aggressive plans to hire top talent quickly.

  • Hire great SDRs, AEs, and other supporting roles in Sales Enablement, Sales Operations, etc.

  • Screen resumes, conduct interviews, and assess candidates’ skills and cultural fit.

  • Regularly meet with the Sales Leadership team to provide pipeline updates and align on staffing needs and requirements.

  • Outbound to prospective candidates.

  • Cold call prospective candidates.

  • Cold text prospective candidates.

  • Cold email prospective candidates.

  • Maintain and update applicant tracking systems and recruitment databases.

  • Provide regular updates and reports on recruitment metrics and progress to leadership.

Who you are:

  • Your personality & people skills make people want to work with you.

  • You can take an ambitious idea, like finding & hiring 20 SDRs in 6 weeks, and make it happen in 5 weeks.

  • Picking up the phone and calling potential candidates is part of your daily routine.

  • You have a chip on your shoulder and want to prove you will be a future VP.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.

  • 2+ years of experience in sales recruitment within the SaaS industry.

  • Strong understanding of sales roles and the skills required for success in sales positions.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

  • Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems and recruitment software.

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with sales performance metrics and KPIs.

  • Knowledge of employment laws and best practices in recruitment.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.

  • Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.

  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.

  • A collaborative and inclusive company culture.

  • Flexible work arrangements, including hybrid options.

Benefits

  • Competitive pay and equity

  • Unlimited PTO

  • 100% sponsored Health, dental, and vision insurance

  • 401K (coming soon)

  • Monthly Fitness Stipend

jobs.title: Growth Marketing  Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Double (Formerly Keeper)

Bookkeepers today are stuck working in excel spreadsheets and homegrown project management solutions to support their clients. Double is on a mission to change that.

With our all-in-one tool, bookkeepers can manage their work, communicate with clients, catch hard-to-find errors, and deliver reports to help their small business customers make smarter strategic decisions.

Founded in 2021, Double has raised $12M in funding, backed by leading tech investors like Y Combinator and founders at top startups like Lattice, Front, Superhuman, Plaid, and more. Double currently helps thousands of bookkeepers and accountants manage the books for startups and small businesses across the US.

Double is at an exciting moment in the startup journey. We have product market fit and a roster of customers who love us. Our marketing team is small but hungry. We're looking for a Growth Manager who's ready to step on the gas to get the flywheel moving.

What You'll Do

We’re looking for our first growth marketing hire to help us build and scale our growth engine from the ground up. You’ll work closely with the Head of Marketing to execute campaigns across multiple channels, test new tactics, and help drive qualified leads to our sales team. This role is perfect for someone with a few years of marketing experience at a fast-paced B2B startup who’s ready to take on more ownership while still learning from experienced leaders.

Responsibilities

  • Campaign Execution: Run campaigns across core channels such as email, paid, SEO, and outbound, with an eye toward measurable growth.

  • Drive the martech stack: Help us as we build a modern tech stack and lead the way on experimenting and implementing new tactics and tools.

  • Own website performance: Take primary responsibility for ensuring the website is a high-converting growth channel.

  • PLG marketing support: Collaborate with product and marketing to create campaigns that drive sign-ups, onboard users, and encourage product adoption.

Must Haves

  • 2–5 years of Growth/Demand Gen Marketing experience, ideally in a B2B SaaS (Seed–Series C).

  • Hands-on experience executing marketing campaigns using modern tools and AI.

  • Willingness to try anything once, and see failure as a data-point that helps us get to success.

  • Comfortable managing projects across multiple channels and working with cross-functional teams.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.

  • Familiarity with marketing automation tools (Marketo or Hubspot) and a hunger to create a best-in-class martech stack.

  • Analytical mindset — able to use data to evaluate success and inform decisions.

  • A one-page resume.

Nice to Haves

  • Experience with SEO, SEM, AEO, or paid social campaigns.

  • Ability to work with APIs or no-code tools (Zapier, Make, Clay) to connect systems and automate workflows.

  • Experience running lifecycle campaigns that improve product activation, engagement, and retention.

  • Understanding of lead scoring, routing, and CRM data hygiene.

Benefits

  • Competitive pay and equity

  • Unlimited PTO

  • 100% sponsored Health, dental, and vision insurance

Double provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

jobs.title: Implementation Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Double (Formerly Keeper)

Bookkeepers today are stuck working in excel spreadsheets and homegrown project management solutions to support their clients. Double is on a mission to change that.

With our all-in-one tool, bookkeepers can manage their work, communicate with clients, catch hard-to-find errors, and deliver reports to help their small business customers make smarter strategic decisions.

Founded in 2021, Double has raised $12M in funding, backed by leading tech investors like Y Combinator and founders at top startups like Lattice, Front, Superhuman, Plaid, and more. Double currently helps thousands of bookkeepers and accountants manage the books for startups and small businesses across the US.

We're bringing on dozens of new customers each month – you will be the first point of contact for small to mid-sized firms looking to start their journey with Double.

What You'll Do

  • Conduct onboarding calls with prospective customers, train them to use the product, and help them realize value quickly

  • Ensure that all technical implementation and account set-up steps have been completed for each account that you onboard

  • Coordinate with Account Executives to identify any red flags that would hinder the prospect from subscribing to Double 

  • Maintain a high renewal rate after initial three month implementation period (80-85%)

  • Proactively reach out to accounts to ensure they're continuing to reach their goals and respond to any inbound support inquiries in a timely manner

  • Create customer education materials: record video feature overviews, ensure product documentation is up to date, and write user guides when necessary

  • Document best practices and help the team iterate to find the most efficient internal processes that reduce friction and best help our customers succeed

  • Keep your finger on the pulse of trending feature requests and areas within the product that could be improved, then document and share customer feedback with the rest of the team to inform our product roadmap

Who You Are

  • 2-3 years of experience in a customer-facing role at an early-stage SaaS startup

  • Ability to articulate complex concepts in a simple, straightforward manner, both in written and verbal communication

  • Keen attention to detail, thoughtfulness, and a customer-centric mindset

  • Knack and passion for process improvement, documentation, and increasing operational efficiencies

  • Familiarity with modern SaaS technologies such as Slack, Notion, Hubspot and/or Salesforce

  • Accounting/finance experience is preferred; interest in learning the space is required

Benefits

  • Competitive pay and equity

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance

Double provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Double (Formerly Keeper)

Bookkeepers today are stuck working in excel spreadsheets and homegrown project management solutions to support their clients. Double is on a mission to change that.

With our all-in-one tool, bookkeepers can manage their work, communicate with clients, catch hard-to-find errors, and deliver reports to help their small business customers make smarter strategic decisions.

Founded in 2021, Double has raised $6M in seed funding, backed by leading tech investors like Y Combinator and founders at top startups like Lattice, Front, Superhuman, Plaid, and more. Double currently helps thousands of bookkeepers and accountants manage the books for startups and small businesses across the US.

We're growing fast, and we're looking for a Product Manager to prioritize our product roadmap and keep us focused on high-leverage product improvements.

What You'll Do

  • Work with the CEO, CTO, designer, and engineering team to design new features and improve existing features

  • Talk to lots of customers and prospects to understand what's important to them

  • Talk to the Sales, Customer Success, and Support teams to prioritize features that would help them achieve company goals

  • Write lots of tickets and answer clarifying questions from the engineers

  • Use product as a lever to drive business outcomes (MRR, new product adoption, etc.)

Who You Are

  • 2+ years of product management experience experience at a startup

  • You care intensely about user experience

  • You can read and understand API docs at a high level (e.g., the QuickBooks API)

  • Some accounting experience or experience with accounting-related products is required

Benefits

  • Competitive pay and equity

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance

Double provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

--

If you've read this job posting and think you're a great fit, there's one more thing you can do to stand out ahead of the pack: answer the loom recording question.

 - Unlimited PTO

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Double (Formerly Keeper)

Bookkeepers today are stuck working in excel spreadsheets and homegrown project management solutions to support their clients. Double is on a mission to change that.

With our all-in-one tool, bookkeepers can manage their work, communicate with clients, catch hard-to-find errors, and deliver reports to help their small business customers make smarter strategic decisions.

Founded in 2021, Double has raised $12.5M in seed funding, backed by leading tech investors like Y Combinator and founders at top startups like Lattice, Front, Superhuman, Plaid, and more. Double currently helps thousands of bookkeepers and accountants manage the books for startups and small businesses across the US.

We're growing fast, and we're looking for a QA Engineer to accelerate our product and help our customers better serve their small business clients.

Our team

https://getjensen.notion.site/About-our-team-4bbfdf46f6834d42879a96495ccf7242

What you'll do

  • Collaborate closely with a team of 4 QA Engineers to ship software via Continuous Delivery (CD)

  • Perform manual testing across both web and mobile platforms to ensure high-quality user experiences

  • Help evaluate acceptance criteria (AC) completeness and clarity and add improvements where needed

  • Write test cases and manage testing efforts using BrowserStack Test Management (or similar tools)

  • Balance multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced, collaborative environment

Who you are

  • 3+ years of QA experience in fast-paced environments, ideally shipping to production regularly

  • Strong experience writing and evaluating acceptance criteria that drive clear, testable outcomes

  • Experienced in testing both mobile apps and web applications

  • Able to work independently with minimal supervision, while collaborating effectively with your team

  • A quick learner who thrives on adapting to shifting priorities and project needs

  • Familiarity with test case management tools such as BrowserStack or similar

  • Automation experience (Playwright, Cypress, Selenium, etc.) is a plus but not required

  • Bonus: Experience with Postman, SQL, and/or accounting products

Benefits

Competitive pay and equity

Unlimited PTO

Health, dental, and vision insurance (if US/CA)

Double provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Double (Formerly Keeper)

Bookkeepers today are stuck working in excel spreadsheets and homegrown project management solutions to support their clients. Double is on a mission to change that.

With our all-in-one tool, bookkeepers can manage their work, communicate with clients, catch hard-to-find errors, and deliver reports to help their small business customers make smarter strategic decisions.

Founded in 2021, Double has raised $12M in funding, backed by leading tech investors like Y Combinator and founders at top startups like Lattice, Front, Superhuman, Plaid, and more. Double currently helps thousands of bookkeepers and accountants manage the books for startups and small businesses across the US.

What You'll Do

Your job is to find bookkeepers and convince them to schedule a demo with us.

Here's what that looks like on a day-to-day basis:

  • Find prospects and engage them through calls, emails, and social media

  • Develop a keen understanding of Double's product and why people buy it

  • Write clever emails that make people smile and reply

Who You Are

  • You write and speak clearly and concisely

  • You are excited to get after it and crush quota

  • You are willing to eat the frog and make cold calls

  • Some sales experience preferred

Benefits

  • Competitive pay and equity

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance

  • Automatic promotion path to Tier 5 Senior SDR

Double provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

jobs.title: SDR Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Double (Formerly Keeper)

Today's bookkeepers are stuck using Excel spreadsheets and homegrown project management solutions to support their clients. Double is on a mission to change that.

With our all-in-one tool, bookkeepers can manage their work, communicate with clients, catch hard-to-find errors, and deliver reports to help small business customers make smarter strategic decisions.

Founded in 2021, Double has raised $12M in funding, backed by leading tech investors like Y Combinator and founders at top startups like Lattice, Front, Superhuman, Plaid, and more. Double helps thousands of bookkeepers and accountants manage the books for startups and small businesses across the US.

What You'll Do

Your job is to hire and manage a team of 8 - 12 Sales Development Representatives tasked with building pipeline for our Sales team. This SDR Manager will lead a fully outbound Net-New SDR team that cold calls, emails, and sends LinkedIn messages to Accounting and Bookkeeping firms to book demos for Account Executives.

Your OTE consists of base pay and variable pay based on your team's performance. You will also be eligible to earn additional bonuses on top of your OTE as a reward for hiring new hires that exceed quota and when your reps get promoted.

Here's what that looks like on a day-to-day basis:

  • Set and maintain a high-performing culture and morale by overseeing the daily activities and quota performance management of individual SDRs to ensure key performance metrics are met

  • Hire and train new SDRs on Double's product, buyer personas, competition, and tools through various methods (ie, role-plays)

  • Develop and execute career development and leadership plans for direct reports, inclusive of but not limited to daily 1:1 mentoring, coaching on time management, objection handling, prospecting tactics, and active listening skills

  • Strategize with sales and marketing counterparts on pipeline and prospecting initiatives to meet company objectives

  • Report on team performance and forecast to senior leadership

  • Improve team output and efficiency over time by optimizing systems and processes

  • Establish a library of prospecting resources for the SDR team

  • Represent the Sales Development team cross-functionally with leaders of other departments

Who You Are

  • Minimum of 1 year of quota-carrying sales experience as an individual contributor, with a proven, consistent track record exceeding goals

  • Minimum of 1 year of experience building and leading sales development teams with a proven track record of exceeding goals

  • Prior demonstrated success in fast-paced, results-oriented GTM environments, ideally at SaaS companies, and history of consistently performing above quota in an outbound sales environment

  • A passion and excitement for hiring, with a thoughtful approach to team planning and development

  • Ability to articulate contractual, technical, and financial value points to customers, including executive leaders

  • Proficiency in sales and data analytics tools (ie, Salesforce, Outreach, Gong, ZoomInfo, Google Sheets, etc.) and familiarity with email and call automation platforms

  • Ability to leverage data to drive decisions, create systems, and identify process improvements to improve efficiency

  • Strong collaboration and influencing skills, demonstrated through excellent communication and presentation skills

Benefits

  • Competitive pay and equity

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance

  • Monthly health and fitness stipend

  • 401K for USA employees (coming soon)

Double provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Double (Formerly Keeper)

Bookkeepers today are stuck working in excel spreadsheets and homegrown project management solutions to support their clients. Double is on a mission to change that.

With our all-in-one tool, bookkeepers can manage their work, communicate with clients, catch hard-to-find errors, and deliver reports to help their small business customers make smarter strategic decisions.

Founded in 2021, Double has raised $12M in funding, backed by leading tech investors like Y Combinator and founders at top startups like Lattice, Front, Superhuman, Plaid, and more. Double currently helps thousands of bookkeepers and accountants manage the books for startups and small businesses across the US.

What You'll Do

Your job is to convince accounting and bookkeeping practices to use our software.

Here's what that looks like on a day-to-day basis:

  • Convert inbound leads into closed won deals

  • Identify and do cold outreach to prospects via email, cold calling, and LinkedIn messages

  • Run discovery calls, demo calls, free trial calls, and additional meetings with prospects to close deals

  • Work with Customer Success to ensure new prospects are successfully onboarded and expand

  • Communicate feature blockers to the product team

  • Develop a keen understanding of Double's product and why people buy it

Here's some additional info about the role:

  • OTE ranges from $110 - 150K, depending on your level of experience

  • Uncapped Commission, where our top AEs are making ~$230K annually

  • Fully remote position with a few weeks of travel every year for selling events and team offsites

  • Full cycle AE motion where you are prospecting, doing discovery, showing demos of our solution over Zoom with the camera on in all meetings, and closing deals

  • Reps close 3 - 8 deals a week, our MM team's average ACV is $9,000 and our SMB Team's average ACV is $2,800

  • We have a land and expand model, so typically smaller deals are intially sold to new accounts and then the AE and CSMs work to expand Double across more of the accounting practice's clients, for which the AE's get credit for. Larger deals can generate above $24K in net-new revenue

  • Monthly quotas range from $40K to $50K ARR

Who You Are

  • 2+ years of experience selling SaaS with 4-5 figure ACVs

  • You write and speak clearly and concisely

  • Accounting / finance experience is preferred; interest in learning the space is required

Benefits

  • Competitive pay and equity

  • Unlimited PTO

  • 100% sponsored Health, dental, and vision insurance

  • Monthly health and fitness stipend

  • WFH office stipend

Double provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

HERE'S WHAT THAT LOOKS LIKE ON A DAY-TO-DAY BASIS:

 - Convert inbound leads into closed won deals

 - Identify and do cold outreach to prospects via email, cold calling, and LinkedIn messages

 - OTE ranges from $110 - 150K, depending on your level of experience

 - Uncapped Commission, where our top AEs are making ~$230K annually

 - Fully remote position with a few weeks of travel every year for selling events and team offsites

 - Full cycle AE motion where you are prospecting, doing discovery, showing demos of our solution over Zoom with the camera on in all meetings, and closing deals

 - Reps close 3 - 8 deals a week, our MM team's average ACV is $9,000 and our SMB Team's average ACV is $2,800

 - We have a land and expand model, so typically smaller deals are intially sold to new accounts and then the AE and CSMs work to expand Double across more of the accounting practice's clients, for which the AE's get credit for. Larger deals can generate above $24K in net-new revenue

 - Monthly quotas range from $40K to $50K ARR


WHO YOU ARE

 - 2+ years of experience selling SaaS with 4-5 figure ACVs

 - You write and speak clearly and concisely

 - Accounting / finance experience is preferred; interest in learning the space is required


BENEFITS

 - Competitive pay and equity

 - WFH office stipend

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Double (Formerly Keeper)

Bookkeepers today are stuck working in excel spreadsheets and homegrown project management solutions to support their clients. Double is on a mission to change that.

With our all-in-one tool, bookkeepers can manage their work, communicate with clients, catch hard-to-find errors, and deliver reports to help their small business customers make smarter strategic decisions.

Founded in 2021, Double has raised $12M in funding, backed by leading tech investors like Y Combinator and founders at top startups like Lattice, Front, Superhuman, Plaid, and more. Double currently helps thousands of bookkeepers and accountants manage the books for startups and small businesses across the US.

We're bringing on dozens of new customers each month. You will be the main point of contact for larger firms and will be responsible for helping them onboard and succeed in our product.

What You'll Do

Onboarding Prospective Customers

  • Conduct onboarding calls with prospective customers, train them to use the product, complete technical implementation steps, and help them realize value quickly

  • Coordinate with Account Executives to identify any red flags that would hinder the prospect from subscribing to Double 

  • Maintain a high conversion rate from Free Trial to subscribed customer (80-85%)

Expansion of Existing Accounts

  • Proactively reach out to accounts in your pipeline to ensure they're continuing to reach their goals and respond to inbound support inquiries in a timely manner

  • Identify barriers to success or any roadblocks that would hinder accounts from fully adopting the full feature suite Double offers

  • Facilitate continued check-ins, team training calls, and Q&A sessions via Zoom 

  • Create and maintain customer education materials: record video feature overviews and write user guides for content-driven email sequences

  • Drive expansion revenue of existing accounts in your pipeline (increase MRR)

Internal Team Processes

  • Keep your finger on the pulse of trending feature requests and areas within the product that could be improved, then document and share customer feedback with the rest of the team to inform our product roadmap

  • Document best practices, creating templates for customer engagement at key milestones for various user personas

  • Help the team iterate to find the most efficient internal processes that reduce friction and best help our customers succeed

  • Take on additional projects that inspire you and help move the needle for our team

Who You Are

  • 2-3 years of experience in a customer-facing role at an early-stage SaaS startup

  • Ability to articulate complex concepts in a simple, straightforward manner, both in written and verbal communication

  • Keen attention to detail, thoughtfulness, and a customer-centric mindset

  • Knack and passion for process improvement, documentation, and increasing operational efficiencies

  • Familiarity with modern SaaS technologies such as Slack, Notion, Hubspot and/or Salesforce

  • Accounting/finance experience is preferred; interest in learning the space is required

Benefits

  • Competitive pay and equity

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance

Double provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.
